message: I know about the tutorial on the Django website, but I'm wondering if anything exists that is similar to the Rails Tutorial at http://www.railstutorial.org.  That tutorial walks you through a typical Rails environment including the installation of RVM, Ruby 1.9.2, connecting to Github and deploying to Heroku.  I'm envisioning something that begins with a Python installation, followed by setting up virtualenv and pip and then installing Django, mod_wsgi, etc.  Would love to help out on something like this for Django if nothing exists currently.  I think the various parts already exist, it just seems it doesn't exist in a single location.

@JeffSelf there's nothing like that all in one place. Agreed that it would be *awesome* and once epio/djangozoom/whatever hits public availability we can include the easy deply stuff, too. I'd contribute to something like that if I find time.

Not to toot my own horn or anything, but my video tutorials on gigantuan.net cover setting up virtualenv and pip and installing packages and the like. I haven't finished them yet (bad me), but I plan on covering nginx + gunicorn for deployment.
I think that would be great. I would have paid $26 to have this knowledge 1.5 years ago.

I'll have to check those videos when I get a chance, but when I was learning Django I found http://djangobook.com very useful. It may not go into the same details as the Rails tutorial you mentioned, but it covers installation, sessions, caching, deploying, etc. Along with all of the Django basics. Good resource to keep in mind, FWIW.
